channel.title: Keeping a quality mesh, while reducing the number of faces?
channel.description:
i need help on this topic, when i make a model i go over board on the detail, which ends up costing me to have a large number of faces, now i was looking through some mesh from oblivion and they seem to have very few faces and when i do a smooth preview it is of good quality. does any modeling expert here know how this can be done.
i am a maya user, but i guess it would apply to any program.

item.title: Keeping a quality mesh, while reducing the number of faces?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

http://frell262.deviantart.com/art/First-game-object-163655864

Small example of normal mapping.

item.title: Keeping a quality mesh, while reducing the number of faces?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

They are pretty much mutually exclusiveâ€¦what you can do however is use various tricks to give the illusion of detail without increasing poly count, like normal mapping.

item.source: Keeping a quality mesh, while reducing the number of faces?

item.title: Keeping a quality mesh, while reducing the number of faces?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Good topology is what makes them smooth.

Screeny your model?
